Analyst

class MFPipeline.analyst.analyst.Analyst(event_name, analyst_path, config_dict=None, config_path=None)

This is a class that analyzes one event. This class creates bare bones of other analysts and contains elements they all share.

Parameters:

  • event_name – str, name of the analyzed event

  • ra – float, Right Ascention of the analyzed event

  • dec – float, declination of the analyzed event

  • analyst_path – str, path to the folder where the outputs are saved

  • config_dict – dictionary, optional, dictionary with Analyst configuration

  • config_path – str, optional, path to the YAML configuration file of the Analyst

parse_config(config_path)

Parse YAML file with configuration, turn it into a dictionary and add it to self.

Parameters:

config_path – str, path with YAML file containing Analyst configuration.

class MFPipeline.analyst.event_analyst.EventAnalyst(event_name, analyst_path, config_dict=None, config_path=None)

This is a class that analyzes one event. It is a child of the MFPipeline.analyst.analyst.Analyst It takes care of other sub-analysts that fit microlensing models to the light curve, create colour-magnitude diagrams and perform other additional tasks.

An Event Analyst needs either a config_path or config_dict, otherwise it will not work.

Parameters:

  • event_name – str, name of the analyzed event

  • analyst_path – str, path to the folder where the outputs are saved

  • config_dict – dictionary, optional, dictionary with Event Analyst configuration

  • config_path – str, optional, path to the YAML configuration file of the Event Analyst

add_config_dict(conifg_dict)

Adds sections of config relevant to Event Analyst to its configuration file.

Parameters:

conifg_dict – dict, dictionary containing configuration for Event Analyst

parse_config(config_path)

Parse YAML file with configuration, turn it into a dictionary and add it to self.

Parameters:

config_path – str, path with YAML file containing Analyst configuration.

parse_event_config(config_path)

Parse YAML file with configuration, turn it into a dictionary and to

Parameters:

config_path – str, path with YAML file containing additional information needed for an Event Analyst.

parse_light_curves(lc_config)

This function parses the light curve information. :param lc_config: dictionary with light curves specified for the event :return: a list with event names, light curves, survey names, bands

run_cmd_analyst()

Launch CMD Analyst to create a CMD plot for all soultions and specified catalogues.

Returns:

a list of boolean values corresponding to satuts of the created cmd plots.

run_fit_analyst()

Launch Fit Analyst to find all fitting microlensing events. Placeholder.

Returns:

not sure yet?.

run_lc_analyst()

Launch Light Curve Analyst to check the quality of the light curve. Placeholder.

Returns:

not sure yet?.

run_single_analyst()

Perform tasks assigned to a single Event Analyst. First the event is handeled by a Fit Analyst, searching for fitting microlensing models. After fitting is done, output information is passed to a CMD Analyst, that creates a CMD plot for specified catalogs and plots the source and blend for each found solution.

Returns:

status?

class MFPipeline.analyst.cmd_analyst.CmdAnalyst(event_name, analyst_path, catalogue, light_curve_data, config_dict=None, config_path=None)

This is a class that creates a colour-magnitude diagram for one event, one catalogue and one solution. It is a child of the MFPipeline.analyst.analyst.Analyst

A CMD Analyst doesn’t need config dict, but it needs a self.config already initialized by another process.

Parameters:

  • event_name – str, name of the event

  • analyst_path – str, path to the folder where the outputs are saved

  • light_curve_data – dict, dictionary with magnitudes in selected bands for source, blend and baseline; this is a result from fitting.

Notes on configuration:

The configuration dictionary can contain the following keywords:

  • name str, name of the catalogue

  • cmd_path str, optional, path to the catalogue

  • radius float, 30 arcmin if not specified, radius of the search of sources in catalogue around the event, used when searching catalogues available through astroquery

  • optional dict, a dictionary with optional keywords, used in various places in the code.

optional can contain:

  • parallax_quality float, parallax over error constrain demanded for a catalogue search in Gaia catalogues,

  • separator str, separator used in the file with the catalogue

add_cmd_config(catalogue, config_dict)

Add CMD configuration fields to analyst config.

Parameters:

  • catalogue – str, catalogue name

  • config_dict – dict, dictionary with analyst config

load_catalogue_data()

Loads catalogue data based on the catalogue name, and then selects sources within radius. Either loads the catalogue from a file, when file_path was specified, or from a selected survey, using astroquery.

Returns:

a pandas data frame with data to create a cmd, and a list with band labels

load_catalogue_from_file_data(separator=',')

Loads a file with catalogue data from path specified by the user in the configuration.

Returns:

pandas data frame and labels of the bands

load_gaia_data(parallax_quality=5)

Loads data within a specified radius and of specified parallax quality from Gaia catalogues.

Parameters:

  • catalogue_name – str, specified earlier, should contain words “Gaia” and “DRx”, where x is the number of data release (currently supported 1, 2 and 3), for example GaiaDR2 or Gaia_DR3,

  • radius – float, specified earlier, radius of the search for sources around the event,

  • parallax_quality – float, optional, parallax over error lower limit.

Returns:

pandas data frame with magnitudes and labels of the bands used; the bands are Gaia_G, Gaia_BP, and Gaia_RP corresponding to phot_g_mean_mag, phot_bp_mean_mag and phot_rp_mean_mag.

parse_config(config_path)

Parse YAML file with configuration, turn it into a dictionary and add it to self.

Parameters:

config_path – str, path with YAML file containing Analyst configuration.

plot_cmd(source_data, source_labels, cmd_data, cmd_labels)

Create a colour magnitude diagram with magnitudes obtained from fitting plotted on it.

Parameters:

  • source_data – pandas dataframe with magnitudes obtained from fitting microlensing model

  • source_labels – labels of filters of magnitude in the source_data

  • cmd_data – pandas data frame with magnitudes of the sources around the event coming from a survey

  • cmd_labels – labels of filters in the cmd_data

Returns:

status of creating a cmd plot

transform_source_data()

This function transforms a dictionary (light_curve_data) with source, blend and baseline information into two data structures, a pandas data frame with magnitudes assuigned in different filter to source, blend and baseline, and a list with band labels.

Returns:

two data structures, a pandas data frame and band labels.
